page.title: 13Primary Schools.
page.content: Compulsory education is for children age{5 to 16.}Three types of school cater for these ages-{Infant from 5 to 7 years,{Junior}from 7 to 11 years and{Secondary}11 to 16 years. {Infants}and{Juniors}are often housed in the same building which is called a{Primary School. These schools vary in appearance and in methods of teaching.Some have small rooms with doors where a group of perhaps 30 children are taught by one teacher.Others are{open-plan}with no real physical brriers,where the children are taught in{small groups and the teachers may{share the {teaching. The Fairway School is an example, built in 1973,of this open plan type. There are 211 pupils from 4+ to 11 when they{transfer}to the{Secondary school in their neighbourhood.
